Pro tip: If you sign up for the newsletter, you'll get the scoop before everyone else.Healthyish friends,Maybe you’re staring down the last few hours at the office; maybe you’re already in the vacation zone. Or maybe you’re like me, stuck in traffic, desperately trying to get there.Wherever you are, I thought you might want some last-minute recipe ideas for the holiday weekend. I’m not in charge of the cooking where I’m going, but if I were, you can bet I’d be grilling this salmon with whole lemon, some swordfish steaks with heirloom tomatoes, or a couple pounds of shrimp with spicy turmeric-citrus sauce.But the best summer party foods, in my opinion, are the sides. This potato-meets-egg salad with mustard vinaigrette is my never-fail potluck offering and I love the sweetness that dates lend to this celery-cucumber-arugula salad. I’m convinced the best way to eat green beans is with miso, based on this bean salad with miso dressing and these summer beans with miso butter. I nearly squealed when I remembered this roasted pepper caprese from last year’s Farmers’ Market Challenge: I love it so much.Green beans and cucumbers with miso dressing
Alex LauIf there’s space on the grill (or you don’t mind turning on the stove), either of these two summer squash recipes will make you very happy: marinated with lemony ricotta or grilled with red onions and feta. And I’d be doing a disservice if I didn’t mention BA contributor Deb Perelman’s charred eggplant and walnut pesto pasta salad. I make it every summer, and every summer I remember that it’s the only pasta salad for me.I know everyone wants a summer-fruit-centric dessert, in which case: strawberry shortcake! But I’m more interested in something icy-cold, like a frozen Greek yogurt pie or a lemon-sesame semifreddo (use the optional CBD for some extra family-friendly chill). Want more? Here are 28 other summer-friendly dessert ideas.Whatever’s on your reusable plates, I hope you get the peace and quiet—or the fun and party—you’re looking for over this long weekend.
